title: Doomed Structure, Ship, Stately House
description:
Recto: Top Left: dome of a small structure, probably a tomb, shown beside a broken wall.  Bottom left:  A ship with sails reefed.  Right: corner of a stately house built at the edge of the water.  A row of painted arches is shown on the ground floor from which a room projects laterally.  Written in the entablature above the second floor:  "yellow blot...(?)"; "Beyrout" written left top corner. 

Verso: An arch door with steps leading to it; caption: "Door,Beyrout". Center: a shoe; inscribed: "red".  A child upon the arm of a woman.  Head of a woman; written beside: "woman /all white/ excepting copper green/ be/ veil over face".  A headgear. Top left corner: the date, top right: "Beyrout"
name: drawing
